result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:34 AM Defendant Davion J Lminggio in court.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Davion J Lminggio.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Aileen Henry appears for Michah Lminggio.  Michah Lminggio's appearance waived, he is at Juve. det.  Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Atty McClendon requests that the GPS be removed or he be allowed to work. State objects to removing the GPS.  State does not obj. to allowing a work exception with verified hours.  BTC: Bond modification granted in case 22CF709 to allow for job interviews with verification provided to RCAP.  If a job is obtained defendant allowed to go to work with verified hours given to RCAP.  Defendant allowed to go to religious services with verification provided to RCAP.  
Atty Henry orally demands speedy trial.  
Defense asks for jury trial.  
Atty Henry has a bond motion on case 22CF840.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  Defense makes further argument.  State objects with argument.  BTC: Bond modification on case 22CF840 denied.  
All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on January 6, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.
Request to Transport Juvenile- Emailed to RASO 3:05pm

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the co-defendants E.K & D.L. No contact with the victims listed in the complaint (person, property, residence or family). Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

2:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Micah T Lminggio appeared by video, in custody from juvenile detention center.  Attorney Alexander Lee Hahn appeared by video for Micah T Lminggio. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
